Key Match Events: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Boston Red Sox 6-1, officially eliminating the Red Sox from postseason contention.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a double in the fourth inning.
Alejandro Kirk delivered a two-run single in the fifth inning.
Kevin Gausman pitched effectively, blanking the Red Sox for the first five innings.
Triston Casas drove in the only run for the Red Sox with a single in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Red Sox's late-season winning streak ended, and their longshot bid to sneak into the postseason was dashed.
The Red Sox need at least one win in their remaining three games to avoid a losing record and two wins to finish above .500.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wednesday’s game was the final road contest for the Red Sox on the season.
The Red Sox will host Tampa Bay for the final three games of the season, with third place in the American League East likely on the line.
